subject: Bicycles and Bicycling
Cycling, Road
lead_paragraph: Bradley Wiggins of Britain powered across the finish line 26.23 seconds ahead of his nearest rival to claim his first road cycling world title, a convincing victory in the time-trial event in Ponferrada, Spain.
snippet: Bradley Wiggins of Britain powered across the finish line 26.23 seconds ahead of his nearest rival to claim his first road cycling world title, a convincing victory in the time-trial event in Ponferrada, Spain.
